thread.title_full: Ireland v Australia: live scores, where can I watch it on TV, updates, live blog for one-day international featuring new captai | The Advertiser

title: Ireland v Australia: live scores, where can I watch it on TV, updates, live blog for one-day international featuring new captai | The
text:
IT’S the beginning of a new era for Australian cricket, and it’s starting in the unlikeliest of places.
The Aussies will look to move on from their Ashes defeat when they take on Ireland in a one-day international in Belfast, although predictions of heavy rain could end up cruelling those hopes.
TAP HERE FOR A FULL SCORECARD , or scroll down for the latest updates in our blog
ULTIMATE GUIDE: ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT IRELAND V AUSTRALIA
If play does in fact get underway, it will be Australia’s first match in the post-Michael Clarke era, with Steve Smith leading a side that includes debutant Joe Burns and young firebrand Pat Cummins.
However there are still plenty of familiar faces including World Cup player of the tournament Mitchell Starc, gun batsman David Warner and veteran all-rounder Shane Watson.
Ireland will be without star all-rounder Kevin O’Brien but his brother Niall will wear the gloves, while fan favourites Ed Joyce, John Mooney and captain William Porterfield will all be involved.
Watch Ireland v Australia LIVE and EXCLUSIVE on Fox Sports 5 (Channel 506), and get the latest online updates below.
Live: Ireland v Australia (Frame content direct link: http://embed.scribblelive.com/Embed/v7.aspx?Id=1451628&ThemeId=16707 .)
Originally published as Live: Ireland v Australia one-dayer
